original_title: Major Earthquake and Tsunami Threaten Japan’s Central Coast
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st);  A powerful magnitude-7.6 earthquake struck Ishikawa Prefecture on Monday (1), triggering a major tsunami warning for the region.
Residents along the Japan Sea coast, including those in Niigata, Toyama, Yamagata, Fukui, and Hyogo prefectures, were urged to evacuate immediately to higher ground as a precaution.
The Japan Meteorological Agency issued the highest level of tsunami warning for Ishikawa Prefecture, indicating the possibility of waves exceeding 3 meters.
The epicenter of the quake was located off the Noto Peninsula in Ishikawa Prefecture, where an intensity of seven, the highest on the Japanese seismic scale of 0 to 7, was observed.
